comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Joseph Johnson, Jr. was New York City Fire Commissioner, Chief of the New York City Transit Authority and the New York Public Service Commission as well as deputy New York City Comptroller in New York City. He was photographed on September 5, 1913, at the dedication of the National Firemen's Memorial in New York City.

Here is another Bain/LOC photograph taken on the same occasion, from a slightly different angle:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4100332999/]

comment._content: Thanks, Bob. Don't you just love that slouching uniformed guard? Masking out the two other gents makes him appear to be one of the photo's featured personnel.
